questions.text: A 22-Year-old primigravida presents with pain abdomen, contractions and show. She has not had any ANC before. She has no comorbidities. On examination, P-90/min, saturation normal, afebrile, pallor+, RR- 13/min, BP-110/76mmHg. Abdominal examination shows fundus below xiphisternum, vertical lie, cephalic presentation, head engaged, FHR-140/min, contractions-6/10mins. PV examination shows cervix soft, effaced, dilated-7cm, 1.5cm length, membranes absent, head at station +2. NST is normal. The patient had a normal vaginal delivery; the baby cried immediately after birth and weight-3kg. Her placenta is as shown in the image. The clinical significance of the presence of such placenta is: 1. Abortion 2. Antepartum hemorrhage 3. IUGR 4. Preterm delivery Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above The given clinical scenario points towards normal vaginal delivery in primigravida with circum marginate placenta. The given image shows circum marginate placenta/ placenta marginata.

Highyeild:

Placenta marginata —A thin fibrous ring is present at the margin of the chorionic plate where the fetal vessels appear to terminate. Clinical significance: There is increased chance of: Abortion Hydrorrhea gravidarum (excessive watery vaginal discharge) Antepartum hemorrhage Growth retardation of the baby Preterm delivery Retained placenta or membranes .

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Options:A, B & C. Are Incorrect.

questions.text: A 22-Year-old primigravida with 10weeks of gestation visits the OBG Opd for her first Antenatal care. She has no complaints and comorbidities. Her vitals are P- 80/min, BP – 118/84mmHg, afebrile, saturation normal, RR-12/min, pallor present. She was advised routine lab investigations and a dating scan. First dose of tetanus vaccine was given. All of the following are advised to the female except:

options.label: A
options.text: The increased calorie requirement is to the extent of 300 over the nonpregnancy state during second half of pregnancy.

options.label: B
options.text: Supplementation of iron, folic acid and calcium from 24weeks of gestation

options.label: C
options.text: Coitus is not restricted during pregnancy except for women with increased risk of miscarriage or preterm labor.

options.label: D
options.text: Travelling should be avoided in first trimester and last 6weeks

questions.correct_answer: B. Supplementation of iron, folic acid and calcium from 24weeks of gestation
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Supplementation of iron, folic acid and calcium from 24weeks of gestation Supplementary nutritional therapy:there is negative iron balance during pregnancy and the dietetic iron is not enough to meet the daily requirement especially in the second half of the pregnancy . Thus, supplementary iron therapy is needed for all pregnant mothers from 16 weeks onward

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option A. DIET: The diet during pregnancy should be adequate to provide: (a) good maternal health , (b) optimum fetal growth , (c) the strength and vitality required during labor and (d) successful lactation . During pregnancy, there is increased calorie requirement due to increased growth of the maternal tissues, fetus, placenta and increased basal metabolic rate. The increased calorie requirement is to the extent of 300 over the nonpregnancy state during second half of pregnancy. Option C. Coitus: Generally, coitus is not restricted during pregnancy. Release of prostaglandins and oxytocin with coitus may cause uterine contractions. Women with increased risk of miscarriage or preterm labor should avoid coitus if they feel such increased uterine activity. Option D. Travel: Travel by vehicles having jerks is better to be avoided, especially in first trimester and the last 6 weeks. The long journey is preferably to be limited to the second trimester. Rail route is preferable to bus route. Travel in pressurized aircraft is safe up to 36 weeks. Air travel is contraindicated in cases with placenta previa, preeclampsia, severe anemia and sickle cell disease .

Extraedge:

VALUES oF antEnataL Care : To counsel the women about the importance of regular checkup. To screen the high risk cases . Pregnancy can be regularly supervised . To maintain or improve the health status of the woman to the optimum till delivery by judicious advice regarding diet, drugs and hygiene. Care should be thorough and based on an individual woman’s need . Acceptance of advice : During pregnancy, advice regarding diet, drugs, family planning guidance and immunization schedule are better followed than in the nonpregnant state. It is an opportunity to make the patient realize that childbirth is a physiological process and to boost up the psychology so that the patient finds herself confi dent during the ordeal of labor. Reduction in maternal mortality ( about one-seventh) and morbidity . Significant reduction in perinatal mortality (about one-fifth) and morbidity.

questions.text: A 24-Year-old G2P1 with 24 weeks of gestation presents with a history of dog bite 1 day ago. She has had her first dose of tetanus vaccination. No history of comorbidities. Her previous lab investigations and USG are normal. On examination, P-90/min, saturation normal, afebrile, BP-120/84mmHg, RR-12/min, pallor present. On examination of wound, there are bite marks on her left leg posterior aspect with scratches. She says she washed the wound completely after the incident. There is history of previous dog bite 18months ago for which she had complete immunization. The management of this patient is –

options.label: A
options.text: Complete 2nd dose of tetanus vaccine and no rabies vaccine as previously immunised

options.label: B
options.text: Complete 2nd dose of tetanus and administer Rabies vaccine

options.label: C
options.text: Complete 2nd dose of tetanus and give Rabies immunoglobulin

options.label: D
options.text: Complete 2nd dose of tetanus and give both Rabies vaccine and immunoglobulin

questions.correct_answer: B. Complete 2nd dose of tetanus and administer Rabies vaccine
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Complete 2nd dose of tetanus and administer Rabies vaccine The given clinical scenario is that of dog bite in a pregnant woman who has already had Rabies vaccine before. Vaccination in pregnancy- Live virus vaccines ( rubella , measles , mumps, varicella, yellow fever ) are contraindicated . Rabies, hepatitis A and B vaccines, toxoids can be given as in nonpregnant state.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Even though the woman was previously vaccinated for Rabies, two doses of vaccine should be administered for the new exposure. (As dog bite occurred more than 3 months after previous vaccination) Option: C & D. Since the female already has exposure to Rabies immunoglobulin by previously being vaccinated for Rabies, immunoglobulin isn’t required in such cases. Hence are incorrect

questions.text: A 24-Year-old primigravida with 36 weeks of gestation presents for normal ANC. She has no comorbidities. She shows her third trimester usg scan advised during her previous visit. Usg showed suspicion of vasa previa and transvaginal follow up was advised. On examination, P-90/min, BP-126/84mmHg, RR-12/min, saturation normal, pallor+, afebrile. Abdominal examination shows fundus just below xiphisternum, vertical lie, cephalic presentation, head engaged, FHR-146/min. Transvaginal sonography was done and showed placenta wherein cord is attached to membranes. Non Reassuring NST was seen. She developed bleeding. The immediate management in such case is:

options.label: A
options.text: Immediate vaginal delivery or Cesarean section

options.label: D
options.text: Administer iv fluids and monitor pregnancy

questions.correct_answer: A. Immediate vaginal delivery or Cesarean section
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Immediate vaginal delivery or Cesarean section The given clinical scenario points towards vasa previa due to Vellamentous placenta. VELAMENTOUS PLACENTA: The cord is attached to the membranes. The branching vessels traverse between the membranes for a varying distance before they reach and supply the placenta. If the leash of blood vessels happens to traverse through the membranes over lying the internal os , in front of the presenting part, the condition is called vasa previa . Rupture of the membranes involving the overlying vessels leads to vaginal bleeding. As it is entirely fetal blood, this may result in fetal exsanguination and even death .

Highyeild:

VASA PREVIA: It occurs due to velamentous insertion of the cord (i.e. cord inserted onto the fetal membranes) Blood loss which occurs is fetal in origin and so there is increased fetal mortality - (75 to 90%), maternal mortality is not increased. Can be diagnosed antenatally by Doppler study When bleeding occurs: Sinusoidal fetal heart rate pattern seen Diagnosis made at the time of bleeding is by-Singers alkali denaturation test/Apt test Management- Emergency Cesarean section.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option B. Blood transfusion may be required for the baby after evaluation of Hb . The blood lost due to vasa previa is fetal blood not maternal. Hence Option b) is wrong. Option C. Waiting for stoppage of bleeding may lead to fetal demise as fetal blood is lost due to vasa previa. Option D. Immediate delivery should be done to reduce morbidity and mortality of fetus. Monitoring pregnancy instead of delivery would lead to more fetal blood loss and death.

Extraedge:

Apt test/Singers alkali denaturation test Principle: Fetal blood has fetal hemoglobin (HbF) and maternal blood has adult hemoglobin (HbA). HbF is resistant to acid and alkali denaturation (not HbA). therefore when water and blood are mixed with KOH/NaOH, it remains pink if blood is of fetal origin i.e. condition is vasa previa. If it is maternal blood it turns yellow brown in 2 minutes as HbA is denatured easily. i.e. condition is placenta previa.

questions.text: A 24 yr old primigravida with 39 weeks of gestation presents with a history of pain abdomen, contractions, show. She has no comorbidities. Her first and second trimester USG and lab investigations are normal. On examination, P- 90/min, saturation normal, afebrile, BP-120/84mmHg, RR-12/min, pallor +. Abdominal examination shows fundus just below xiphisternum, vertical lie, cephalic presentation, head engaged, FHR-140/min, abdominal contractions 5/10 mins. PV examination shows cervix soft, effaced, 4cm dilated, 2cm in length, head at station +1, membranes absent. NST was normal. She had a normal vaginal delivery and baby was normal weighing 3kg. The placenta was expelled and on examination had intact lobe. The image of the placenta is shown below. The complications associated with such placenta are: Postpartum hemorrhage Uterine sepsis Subinvolution Polyp formation Select the correct answer from the given below code
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above The clinical case scenario is that of normal vaginal delivery in a primigravida . The placenta shown in the image has a succenturiate lobe .

Highyeild:

PLACENTA SUCCENTURIATA Morphology: One (usual) or more small lobes of placenta, size of a cotyledon, may be placed at varying distances from the main placental margin. A leash of vessels connecting the main to the small lobe traverse through the membranes . The accessory lobe is developed from the activated villi on the chorionic laeve. In cases of absence of communicating blood vessels , it is called placenta spuria . The incidence of placenta succenturiata is about 3%. Diagnosis : Diagnosis is made following inspection of the placenta after its expulsion. With intact lobe—the features have already been described With missing lobe: (a) there is a gap in the chorion and (b) torn ends of blood vessels are found on the margin of the gap. Clinical significance: If the succenturiate lobe is retained , following birth of the placenta, it may lead to: Postpartum hemorrhage which may be primary or secondary Subinvolution Uterine sepsis Polyp formation. TREATMENT:Whenever the diagnosis of missing lobe is made, exploration of the uterus and removal of the lobe under general anesthesia is to be done . Succenturiate Placenta A succenturiate lobe is a variation in placental morphology and refers to a smaller accessory placental lobe that is separate to the main disc of the placenta. There can be more than one succenturiate lobe.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. Only 1 as all 4 are correct so this is not a appropriate statement . Option:B. 1 and 2 as all 4 are correct so this is not a appropriate statement . Option:C. 1, 2 and 3 as all 4 are correct so this is not a appropriate statement .

questions.text: A 24-Year-old woman presents to OBG Opd for Antenatal care. This is her first visit of ANC. She says her LMP was 11weeks ago. She has no comorbidities. She was pregnant two years ago and had twin gestation out of which one of the twins died immediately after birth. There is history of induced abortion at 12weeks of gestation before twin pregnancy. The obstetric score of the woman is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

G3P1A1L1 G =3 as she is currently pregnant ,had twins delivery 2 years ago and 1 abortion before twins. P=1 as only when is delivered Twins is the when her pregnancy gone beyond period of viability. A=1 as she had 1 abortion L=1 as when delivered twin one of the twin died . Gravida and parity: Gravida denotes a pregnant state both present and past , irrespective of the period of gestation. Parity denotes a state of previous pregnancy beyond the period of viability . Gravida and para refer to pregnancies and not to babies. As such, a woman who delivers twins in first pregnancy is still a gravida one and para one. A pregnant woman with a previous history of two abortions and one term delivery can be expressed as fourth gravida but primipara.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. G3P2A2 is incorrect option Option:B. G3P1A2 is incorrect option Option:D. G4P2A1L1 is incorrect option

questions.text: A 25yr old primigravida with 39weeks of gestation presents with pain abdomen, back ache, contractions, show. She has no comorbidities. Her previous lab investigations and usg are normal. On examination, P-90/min, pallor +, BP-128/84mmHg, RR-12/min, saturation normal, afebrile. Abdominal examination shows fundus just below xiphisternum, vertical lie, cephalic presentation, head engaged, FHR-140/min, contractions-5/10mins. PV examination shows cervix soft, effaced, 4cm dilated,2cm long, head at station 0, membranes intact. NST normal. She delivered a 3.2kg baby vaginally and the baby cried immediately after birth. Third stage was monitored. Even after 40mins post delivery, placenta was not separated. Oxytocin was administered. On examination placenta is seen separated but not expelled due to constriction which is felt. Sequence of Management of such condition Deepening the plane of anesthesia Separation of placenta from above downwards Cone shaped hand introduced Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 3, 2 The given clinical scenario points towards retained placenta due to hour glass contraction of the uterus. Management: The ring should be made to relax by deepening the plane of anesthesia (halothane is useful in these cases), then the cone shaped hand is introduced and the separation of the placenta is preferably done from above downward to minimize bleeding.

Highyeild:

Hour-glass contraction— The placenta, either unseparated or separated—partially or completely, may be trapped by a localized contraction of circular muscles of the uterus. This may be situated at the junction of the lower and upper segment or may be placed in one cornu. Administration of any oxytocin, especially ergometrine in the active management of third stage or undue irritability of the uterus by premature attempts to express the placenta is the important cause. Diagnosis is only made during attempted manual removal . Management: The ring should be made to relax by deepening the plane of anesthesia (halothane is useful in these cases), then the cone shaped hand is introduced and the separation of the placenta is preferably done from above downward to minimize bleeding.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. 1 , 2 is incorrect option Option:C. 3, 1, 2 is incorrect option Option:D. 3, 2 is incorrect option

questions.text: A 26-Year-old G2A1 with 38weeks of gestation presents with pain abdomen, dark and show. She had a spontaneous abortion at 10weeks 1yr ago. She has no comorbidities. Her previous lab investigations and usg are normal. On examination, P-90/min, RR-14/min, BP-130/78mmHg, saturation normal, pallor +, afebrile. Abdominal examination shows fundus just below xiphisternum, vertical lie, cephalic presentation, head engaged, FHR-140/min, contractions-5/10mins. PV examination shows cervix soft, effaced, 5cm dilated, 2cm long, head at station +1, membranes present, vessels felt below the presenting part. NST was non Reassuring. She had normal vaginal delivery and baby was normal, cried immediately after birth, weight-3kg. The placenta is shown below which is?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Velamentous placenta The given clinical scenario points towards normal vaginal delivery with presence of Velamentous placenta.

Highyeild:

VELAMENTOUS PLACENTA: The cord is attached to the membranes. The branching vessels traverse between the membranes for a varying distance before they reach and supply the placenta. If the leash of blood vessels happens to traverse through the membranes over lying the internal os , in front of the presenting part, the condition is called vasa previa . Rupture of the membranes involving the overlying vessels leads to vaginal bleeding. As it is entirely fetal blood, this may result in fetal exsanguination and even death .

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option A. BATTLEDORE PLACENTA : The cord is attached to the margin of the placenta. If associated with low implantation of the placenta, there is chance of cord compression in vaginal delivery leading to fetal anoxia or even death; otherwise, it has got little clinical significance. Option C. Circumvallate placenta —(1) The fetal surface is divided into a central depressed zone surrounded by a thickened white ring which is usually complete. The ring is situated at varying distances from the margin of the placenta. The ring is composed of a double fold of amnion and chorion with degenerated decidua (vera) and f ibrin in between (2) Vessels radiate from the cord insertion as far as the ring and then disappear from view (3) The peripheral zone outside the ring is thicker and the edge is elevated and rounded. Option D. Placenta marginata— A thin fibrous ring is present at the margin of the chorionic plate where the fetal vessels appear to terminate

questions.text: A 26-Year-old G3A1P1 with 26weeks of gestation presents to the OPD for normal ANC. She complains of pedal edema. She has no comorbidities. Her previous lab investigations and usg were normal. She is on oral iron and calcium tablets. On examination, P-90/min, BP-134/84mmHg, pallor+, B/L pedal edema upto ankle seen, RR-13/min, saturation normal, afebrile. Abdominal examination shows fundus just above umbilicus, vertical lie, FHR-140/min. She is advised to follow up after:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Interval of 4weeks The given clinical scenario is that of G3P1A1 pregnancy to be advised on further follow up. Generally, checkup is done at intervals of 4 weeks up to 28 weeks; at intervals of 2 weeks up to 36 weeks and thereafter weekly till delivery.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:B. Interval of 2weeks is not appropriate . Option:C. Interval of 1 week is not appropriate Option:D. None of the above is not appropriate .

questions.text: A 26 yr old primigravida with 39 weeks of gestation presents with pain abdomen, back ache, contractions, show. She has no comorbidities. Her previous lab investigations and usg are normal. On examination, P-90/min, pallor +, BP-128/84mmHg, RR-12/min, saturation normal, afebrile. Abdominal examination shows fundus just below xiphisternum, vertical lie, cephalic presentation, head engaged, FHR-140/min, contractions-5/10 mins. PV examination shows cervix soft, effaced, 4cm dilated,2cm long, head at station 0, membranes intact. NST normal. She delivered a 3.2kg baby vaginally and baby cried immediately after birth. Third stage was monitored. Even after 40mins post delivery, placenta was not separated. Oxytocin was administered. The risk associated are all except: Hemorrhage Shock Puerperal sepsis Risk of recurrence in next pregnancy Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above All of the above is the answer.The given clinical scenario points towards retained placenta. Which will cause all the above risks.

Highyeild:

RETAINED PLACENTA : DEFINITION: The placenta is said to be retained when it is not expelled out even 30 minutes after the birth of the baby (WHO 15 minute s). DANGERS: The risks involved in prolonged retention of placenta are: Hemorrhage . Shock is due to— (a) blood loss, (b) at times unrelated to blood loss, especially when retained more than one hour and (c) frequent attempts of abdominal manipulation to express the placenta out. Puerperal sepsis. Risk of its recurrence in next pregnancy.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. Only 3 is not an appropriate option. Option:B. Only 4 is not an appropriate option. Option:C. 3 and 4 are not appropriate options.

questions.text: A 30-Year-oldG2P1 with 37weeks of gestation presents with history of reduced fetal movements since 1day. She has no comorbidities. Her previous lab investigations and usg are normal. On examination, P-90/ min, saturation normal, pallor +, BP-128/78mmHg, RR -14/min, afebrile. Abdominal examination shows fundus just below xiphisternum, vertical lie, cephalic presentation, head engaged, FHR-110/min. NST had variable and late Decelerations. Cord compression was suspected. Induction of labour was done and she had a normal vaginal delivery. The placenta is shown below. It is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Battledore placenta BATTLEDORE PLACENTA : The cord is attached to the margin of the placenta. If associated with low implantation of the placenta, there is chance of cord compression in vaginal delivery leading to fetal anoxia or even death ; otherwise, it has got little clinical significance.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option A. VELAMENTOUS PLACENTA: The cord is attached to the membranes . The branching vessels traverse between the membranes for a varying distance before they reach and supply the placenta. If the leash of blood vessels happens to traverse through the membranes overlying the internal os , in front of the presenting part, the condition is called vasa previa. Rupture of the membranes involving the overlying vessels leads to vaginal bleeding. As it is entirely fetal blood, this may result in fetal exsanguination and even death. Option C. Circumvallate placenta —(1) The fetal surface is divided into a central depressed zone surrounded by a thickened white ring which is usually complete. The ring is situated at varying distances from the margin of the placenta. The ring is composed of a double fold of amnion and chorion with degenerated decidua (vera) and fibrin in between (2) Vessels radiate from the cord insertion as far as the ring and then disappear from view (3) The peripheral zone outside the ring is thicker and the edge is elevated and rounded. Option D. Placenta marginata —A thin fibrous ring is present at the margin of the chorionic plate where the fetal vessels appear to terminate

questions.text: Hematoma of the sternomastoid muscle detected in a 16 days old infant requires:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

No immediate therapy No immediate therapy is required in this case.this will resolve spontaneously and Massage is contra indicated .

Highyeild:

Sternomastoid tumour/Hematoma: Presents at about 7-10 days after birth Situated at the junction of upper and middle third of the muscle Etiology: rupture of sternocleidomastoid muscle fibres and blood vessels, hematoma and cicatricial contracture Associated with Difficult breech delivery or Attempted delivery after shoulder dystocia Excessive lateral flexion of neck following normal delivery. Clinical features: Transient torticollis NO MASSAGE Treatment: No treatment required, disappears spontaneously by 6 months of age. Gentle movements and stretching of muscle done after feeds is useful

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. Immediate surgical evacuation is not the correct option . Option:B. Surgical intervention within 2 weeks is not the correct option . Option:C. Prophylactic antibiotic therapy is not the correct option .

questions.text: Hydrocephalus is best detected antenataly by:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ultrasonography Hydrocephalus is a condition in which there is an abnormal increase in cerebrospinal fluid within the ventricular and subarachnoid spaces of brain. The prenatal diagnosis of hydrocephalus is usually made by demonstration of a dilated ventricular system in an ultrasound examination.

Highyeild:

USG features of HYDROCEPHALUS Earliest and most accurate sonographic sign of hydrocephalus - Enlarged lateral ventricles. The lateral ventricle is measured at the level of atrium. Normal transverse diameter of atrium is 7 mm ± 1 mm (It remains constant during the second and third trimester When diameter of atrium is >10 mm, it is called as Ventriculomegaly/Hydrocephalus Other signs of hydrocephalus on USG: Dangling choroid plexuses. Thinning out of cerebral cortex.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. X-ray abdomen is an incorrect option . Option:B. Amniocentesis is an incorrect option Option:C. Clinical examination is an incorrect option

questions.text: Which cardiovascular change is physiological in last trimester of pregnancy?

options.label: C
options.text: Shift of apical impulse laterally and upwards in left 4th intercostal space

questions.correct_answer: C. Shift of apical impulse laterally and upwards in left 4th intercostal space
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Shift of apical impulse laterally and upwards in left 4th intercostal space

Highyeild:

Clinical findings related to cardiovascular changes occurring during pregnancy: Heart rate ( resting) increases by about 10 – 15 bpm. Apex beat shifts to the 4th intercostal space, 2.5 cm outside the mid clavicular line (as heart is pushed upwards, outward, with slight rotation to left ). Slightly enlarged cardiac silhouette. (marked enlarged cardiac silhouette is not normal in pregnancy) Exaggerated splitting of the first heart sound (both components loud). Second heart sound :Normal Third heart sound : Loud and easily auscultated. Murmurs :– Grade II systolic ejection murmur is audible in aortic or pulmonary area at about 10-12 weeks due to expanded intravenous volume. It disappears in the beginning of postpartum period. Continuous hissing murmur audible over the tricuspid area in left 2nd and 3rd intercostal spaces known as Mammary murmur. ECHO – Shows increased left atrial and ventricular diameters. ECG – Shows left axis deviation. Chest X-ray – Straightening of left heart border.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option:A. MID diastolic murmur Option:B . Occasional atrial fibrillation Option:D . Cardiomegaly
